Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Enterocin K1 (EntK1, natural AMPs; class 2d bacteriocin, leaderless, Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; BBrcp)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of this peptide shows 46.7% similarity toEntEJ97.  Mol formula:  C218H325N51O51S2; Mol Wt  4564.386.    GRAVY= -0.7; Wimley-White whole-residue hydrophobicity of the peptide:  2.54  kcal/mol.    Mol ex. coeff. 15632.5.Activity: Highly Potent against E. faecium.  (?) rseP Expression in S. pneumoniae confers sensitivity to EntEJ97/EntK1.Structure:  3D structure was determined in 50% TFE by NMR: A central  helix with both termini disordered. Simialr to LsbB, this peptide targets the receptor RseP.
Literature Information.Author: Ovchinnikov KV, Kristiansen PE, Straume D, Jensen MS, Aleksandrzak-Piekarczyk T, Nes IF, Diep DB.2017
Literature Information.Title: The Leaderless Bacteriocin Enterocin K1 Is Highly Potent against Enterococcus faecium: A Study on Structure, Target Spectrum and Receptor
